Reviews.Title: “Terrible is an understatement!”
Reviews.Author: gary s
Reviews.Content: I have travelled for my job every week for the past two years. I am in San Diego twice a month and normally stay in La Jolla, but they were sold out so I decided on the residence inn mission valley because of the location and I love Marriotts. So I arrived at 4:15, and no rooms were ready, even though check in is "guarenteed" by 4. No big deal, they said they would call as soon as a room was ready so I got some lunch while I was waiting. I never got a phone call, so I went back after my lunch at 5:30 or so and finally was able to get a room. When I got to the room I was assigned, it was not even cleaned! So I went back to the front desk, which is not easy at this hotel because you have to go outside and it was raining, to inform them and get a new room. So after arriving at 4:15, I did not get into a clean room until almost 6. They were serving a full dinner until 7, it was wings that night which sounded great, but by the time I got to my room and down to the dinner at 6:40, there were no wings left! So by now, I was a little frustrated but still ok with the situation. Then, the next day after work I wanted to shower, but during the service that day, no towels were left which was weird. I called and politely asked for more towels, which then took about 45 minutes to get there. This is when I started to get frustrated because of all the mishaps so I called to speak to a manager, but no manager was on duty to speak with so I asked the front desk to have them contact me the next morning on my cell phone because I would already be checked out and at work, but never received a call!! Are you kidding me?? In the end, I paid about $450 for a frustrating experience and I WILL NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN!!! Recommend that others do the same!!! Sincerely, Wow Your Hotel Is Bad

Reviews.Title: “great hotel to choose”
Reviews.Author: Karen M
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with the accomadations! They offer free breakfast every day, and free dinners 4 nights per week. (And, it is tasty!) They have a separate eating area for the kids which they love! The pool and hot tub are clean and fun! The rooms are very quiet and comfortable. The staff is very friendly and it is a very conveniently located hotel to all of the attractions. I will happily return to this hotel again the next time i visit San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelersNJ
Reviews.Content: While I have elite status within the Marriott brands, I have to admit that I have never been a big fan of the Residence Inn product. The concept makes sense for mulit-night stays, providing a kitchen, but this means cutbacks in the quality of the bedding, bathrooms, etc. in the race to remain competitively priced. On our recent trip to the San Diego area, we spent a night in this hotel located about a mile down the road from Old Town San Diego. The check-in representative was genuinely caring and helpful. The next morning, the front desk staff (especially Theo) was particularly helpful with recommendations, our requests for beach towels, and our extended checkout time needs. The staff understands the service industry and made our stay more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great People”
Reviews.Author: martin p
Reviews.Content: I was sent to San Diego to work and arrangements were made for us to stay at Residence Inn Mission Valley. The staff could not have been more friendly and everyone went out of there way to make us feel welcome and at home.The rooms were large and equipped with full size appliances in case you wanted to cook in your room. Breakfase and dinner were provided mon-thurs. if you wanted it. I very much enjoyed my experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We're coming back!”
Reviews.Author: Shirley-Avila
Reviews.Content: Love the happy hour, Albert is the man! lobby with the Killer whale statue, the decor thru out is beautiful, will ALWAYS stay at this location when in SD....

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: mint-lady
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 (2 parents, 1 grandma, 2 teenagers, and one little one) shared a 1 bedroom suite for a 4 night stay and we couldn't have been more pleased! The two queen beds and sofa bed gave everyone plenty of sleeping room while the daily hot breakfasts and evening meals were wonderful and really helped with our budget. The pool was nice and clean and the housekeeping staff was AMAZING! Every employee we encountered was pleasant, friendly, knowledgeable, and every one of them greeted us - in the hall, in the dining room, at the desk - they all greeted us and wished us a good day/night! The room was comfortable and quiet even though there were several families with small children at the hotel during our stay. The fitness center, game room, and outdoor bbq and firepit were great amenities. The only "complaint" I have was in regard to an evening fire alarm which went off... while we were all standing outside in the parking lot, no one from the hotel came out to let us know it was a false alarm and we could go back inside. We were practically the last family standing outside in our jammies waiting for the "all clear" which never came. Aside from that small oversight though, it was a wonderful stay and I HIGHLY recommend this hotel for anyone looking to stay in the San Diego area. It was convenient to Old Town and not too far from the "downtown" area or the airport. Just can't say enough good things about our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: NativeNH
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2-bedroom room for a three night stay for 3 adults and 2 children while our San Diego house was having work done. This hotel was the perfect fit for us. Perfectly located for a staycation with lots of room for all of us. The kids enjoyed the extra space and layout. We were concerned our two children might be too noisy for neighboring rooms, yet we never heard anyone above us or on either side; so hopefully no one heard us either. The onsite breakfast and dinner was definitely convenient and appreciated. Not every option was stellar but over all the food was good, hot and plentiful. The kids enjoyed the communal eating area and the self service. The room was super clean; which was really important too us. The bed linens were crisp and fresh, sheets could have been a bit longer in length but not a big issue. We didn’t interact with the staff much but they all were very nice and pleasant. The mattresses were ok, probably could be replaced soon. The pillows were very nice though. The weather was cool but we still enjoyed the Jacuzzi each night which was a great size and well accommodating. Loved that both the pool and Jacuzzi had a wheelchair lift though not necessary for our group. We felt very safe at this location and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very hospitable”
Reviews.Author: Eddiesalvatore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for over a month. Breakfast and dinner served for free 5 days a week was really convenient for the length of stay so I saved a lot of money. They also have hospitality hour where you can get free beer or wine which was really nice. The front desk staff was excellent. Siyeh, Brian, Piers and Courtney were very friendly and always had suggestions for great places to eat and they always took care of everything I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious, comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Elisha F
Reviews.Content: We came to Residence Inn MV for a midweek stay while we had to be out of our San Diego home for the week. As a family of five, hotel stays are not our favorite thing, but this time was perfect. We had a large spacious room with a full kitchen (important since I had to pack lunches for school each day). Our family loved and appreciated the breakfasts and dinners provided. Our room was clean and the new renovation was very appealing. This hotel is a great place to stay and everyone we encountered was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, breakfast topped it off!”
Reviews.Author: jrod9
Reviews.Content: The kids loved the heated pool...although it could have been a little warmer. We all ended up in the jacuzzi because we could only take the cold for so long, then again it was a winter night when we first went in, and a less than sunny morning the second time. The room was excellent. It had a king size bed with a pull out couch, and the best kitchenette we have ever seen at a hotel. And to save the best for last: Warm Breakfast...that's right, not continental...WARM! Ohhhh just remembering my pleasant surprise!!! PS. Reason for not giving 5 stars for value: $180 bill for just the room & parking. I feel that's a little too much. I know most hotels do this...but I still cannot be ok with paying to park my car for staying at a place I'm already paying for! Hopefully that helps some of you as a starting point or as leverage.

Reviews.Title: “Grossly Filthy”
Reviews.Author: yNCAWE7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used to like this place due it's close to my husband's conference venue ... until Oct 2011. On the nighnt we checked in, I already noticed a huge difference in housekeeping: bathroom was grossly filthy (door had yellow stuff clinging on its panels and brownish hand marks as well, floor was dirty, light switches were dirty, toilet bowl was very nasty, brownish coloration clinging inside the bowl). Trash was full under kitchen cabinet, my husband had to take it out himself. The bed sheets and pillow cases smelled like sweat. There were only 5 small hangers in the closet (for a 6 day stay, 12 pairs of outfit for my husband and my self, 5 hangers aren't sufficient). I addressed the cleanliness issue to the front desk and I fairness, she offered to transfer us to a different room but since it was past 11 PM and having cleaned the bathroom door, disinfected all the lateral surface including toilet bowl, door knobs, light switches, and tv remote control, I just asked to have the linens/pillowcases changed and provide more hangers. Well, it took me a phone call, 1 trip to the front desk, and my husband to take a trip again to the front desk before we get a clean set of linens and more hangers.....a total of over 1 hour. Speaking of housekeeping, the batch of housekeepers were the MOST LAZY I have ever encountered (next to Residence Inn Airport and Greenbrier Norfolk, VA). I have to call to get our room serviced, ask for fresh towels, and have our linens changed mid-week). This place used to be pleasant in 2009-2010. I don't know what happen, but one thing for sure, WE ARE NOT COMING BACK until they achieve an acceptable housekeeping standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: busrider53
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time staying in this hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast is very good and has a variety of food to choose from. The managers social hour on Monday thru Thursday was hosted by a great staff and the food was delicious. If we go back to San Diego we will definately stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family hotel”
Reviews.Author: yarraridge
Reviews.Content: The staff are great - especially Jessica who was great with the kids and was even willing to go out and buy firm pillows for me. I hadn't complained she just asked what could we do better and I said better pillow choice not everyone likes soft pillows.... I was leaving the next day so told her not to worry. We had two strollers delivered to the hotel that we had bought on Amazon from Australia and the engineering department very kindly put them together for us. Perfect time of year (Australian school holidays) and NO crowds at breakfast or pool. Close to shops, theme parks and very quiet. Internet was good. Pool was warm as well even in winter could go swimming. Only complaint was the $13 a day parking when Anaheim doesn't charge - as it is controlled by boom gates surely they don't need to? Would recommend it highly - clean, friendly staff, great location. Much much better than RI Anaheim which was our next stop!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed at in years!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Skelt11
Reviews.Content: I have no better way of saying how much I love this hotel and their staff than saying I stayed here for 300 days last year. I have the option of staying at other hotels, but I choose this one. I was working closer for the first 8 months or so, but now work about 40 minutes away and still stay here. The staff is the friendliest and truly make this hotel. Any time I have had an issue, it has always been addressed immediately and I always receive a note in my room. And I have had very few issues. The hotel has been recently remodeled and the rooms are great. The breakfast is the best in the area, not your typical warmed in the microwave type. Fresh eggs, biscuits and gravy, some sort of meat, fresh fruit, juice, etc. The lounge is pretty much a full bar with out the hard liquor. They have at least 5 beers on tap and 4 or 5 wines. But the staff is what makes this hotel. Shelby, Courtney, Todd, Lilly, and Taylor are awesome. They knew my name from day one and always go out fo their way to make my stays great. They were out of a drink I like in their little store and went out to Costo, bought some, and stocked the fridge in my and left a note in my room. This hotel is what I call home. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with good access to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SerenityTrugger
Reviews.Content: Little bit of an odd layout to this one but has benefits in its uniqueness. Plenty of room in the hotel as well. Everything is pretty open. I stay here most of the time when in San Diego due to its affordable price and its location. Easy to go anywhere in San Diego from there.

Reviews.Title: “A top hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Russell2908
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot on business and spend a lot of time in hotels. This hotel has definitely impressed me. All of the staff are very friendly, the rooms are clean and comfortable. The breakfast and the evening meals are very good. To top it off the gym is pretty well equipped to. Anyone staying in the San Diego area should definitely try and get into this hotel. I spent 5 weeks here and am very happy that I chose this Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: hamishmom
Reviews.Content: Nice accomodations. Breakfast and light dinner were excellent. The extra parking charge they have added seems a little bit "it's just because we can."

Reviews.Title: “It was awful”
Reviews.Author: TisiphoneHawaii
Reviews.Content: I'm a Marriott rewards member and not one of my requests were acknowledged at check-in. I even called ahead to make sure I got a high floor since this hotel accepts animals and I was told they generally keep them on the lower floors. So of course at check-in, I'm given a room on the first floor and cant be moved until morning since they are booked-up. There were so many problems here I can't even imagine trying to detail everything in one review so i'll be brief. Front desk was a bit scatty-boo and un-organized, elevator broke during our stay and was never repaired, our card keys only worked once and a while which is really awesome when you need it to get into the parking lot (so yea, cars are waiting behind you and your stupid card wont work). The room layout is the most idiotic thing I have ever seen. Our room had two bedrooms with one bathroom that is only accessible through the master room. VERY inconvenient for anyone sleeping in there, it was so annoying. Housekeeping rarely ever did anything to our room and would never refill or replace anything. I had to call the front desk to get tissue replaced and after 2 days it was replaced. I requested additional pillows my second day there and those didn't even show up until day 5. That's just to list a few things that happened. This hotel truly made me give up any hope of salvaging our stay. I hated every moment spent there. The only redeeming thing this hotel had was the breakfast, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, friendly, helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Jeff S
Reviews.Content: We just completed a 4 night stay at this hotel. The newly refurbushed rooms were great. Very friendly and helpful staff, superb cutomer service. Great location as it is 5-10 minutes to seemingly everywhere: the zoo, Mission Bay, Mission Hills, Old Town, downtown. Very convenient. Was aware of the $13/day parking fee which seemed odd based on the location, but every hotel in the San Diego area seems to be doing it. Very nice hot breakfast and evening refreshments (unfortuately only Bud beer). There are several restaurants within a 5 minute drive as well as an upscale mall that has good shoping and several restaurants. There is also "Ricky's" a family restaurant about 50 yards west of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extended Stay with family”
Reviews.Author: claymac
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 30 days for a work trip. We had a 1 bedroom suite with kitchen. I took my family along including a 3 yr old and 1 year old, but we squeezed into the 1 bedroom since it was covered by per diem. All I can say is that we loved this place. The customer service is just outstanding. By the time we finished our stay we got to know just about every member of the staff and several of the maintenance folks. They were all top notch. Here are just a few examples of how they took care of us: - For stays over a month they provide free parking. We were just under that, but they still provided it - for 2 cars. - When we got there our room did not have the separate bedroom but was more of a suite. We really needed the separate bedroom for our jet lagged kids. They moved us right away no problem. - We needed a network cable that would reach our bedroom so we could let the kids sleep in the other room. Until they could make a wire long enough for us (the next day) they provided a wireless router in the interim to make sure we were happy. - There was a Southern California power outage one night that shut the city down. The management handled it great. They just extended the complimentary dinner hours and complimentary open bar until they ran out of stuff and cranked up the grill and started grilling all their burgers and dogs for the guests. It was like a big party! - Even with the power outage, the maintenance guys came right away and changed the battery in our beeping smoke alarm. In summary, we loved it and we will stay there any time we are back in town. It's one of the best deals I've ever found for a place with a separate bedroom which is a necessity with napping kids. The kids loved the pool and hot tub and the staff were very friendly to them. The complimentary breakfast and dinner really saved us a ton and the complimentary open bar was just awesome. The location is nice and central although Mission Valley is always busy around the mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at RI Mission Valley”
Reviews.Author: federer_123
Reviews.Content: We just completed 4 days stay at this hotel Great Service, clean room, Free breakfast Kitchen if needed. 5 mins to Seaworld, less than 15 mins to Zoo less than 30mins to Safari. Free Wine/Beer from 5-7 everyday. Close to Old Town There are no restaurants nearyby... $13 parking (which everyone does) Wired connection only inside the room They have few restaurants deliver (italian,chinese, thai) to the room. --> This worked as we got to the hotel late night. if you need dish wash liquid, ask for it as its not in the kitchen Stayed in 4th floor towards back of the building. no view and no noise. Didn't use the pool/hot tub Will definitely go and stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great for a large multi-generational family.”
Reviews.Author: Nanook13
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here- 2 bedroom suite with 5 adults & 2 children.We were in San Diego to attend our grandson's graduation from Boot Camp at the Marine Depot. Great access to everything we did in SD. Great value with the free breakfast (great selections!), & dinner on weeknights, also free beer or wines on weeknights. We also used the kitchen in our suite & found it adequate, although we needed more silverware, glasses etc. for our large group. Anytime we had interaction with either the front desk, kitchen, housekeeping or bar staff they were pleasant & went out of their way to accommodate our requests quickly. I do agree with others; (the "catch" that keeps me from giving 5 stars), is that the parking fee doesn't make much sense, and it is a bit inconvenient to use the "correct" elevator to get to the walkway to the main buliding where the meals were served.(not all of the elevators went to the 1st floor.) Also, we did get a nice suggestion via phone from the front desk almost as soon as we walked in the door of our room, that we needed to keep our grandsons a bit quieter- but that only occured once, so perhaps the walls are a bit thin. The fire alarm going off in the middle of the night when a guest elsewhere burned popcorn was definitely disconcerting. We tried to call the front desk (as did everyone on the property) & could not get through. It would have been nice to be told that everything was ok, as we had a few moments where we were getting everyone ready to evacuate.One fun activity they had going on was a gingerbread house competition between the staff. I think the guests really enjoyed this & observed that many guest were very thoughtful to look closely at each of the houses & cast their vote. I will actually check to see who won!

Reviews.Title: “nice stay... hate parking fee not needed.”
Reviews.Author: aussietraveller57
Reviews.Content: well we have stayed at various residence inn hotels throughout the US. In general, they are a bit more expensive, but the places are usually well maintained and comfortable. We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit, with the usual kitchen , double bathrooms, sofa bed. This Hotel is well kept and we have no complaints except one.... as others have brought up... THE PARKING FEE OF $13 A DAY.... sorry, but I could understand if you were located in the centre of the city! but you are not. There is plenty of room. Ok, now that I have had my whinge, the place is quiet and enjoyable. The breakfast and Happy hour is excellent. We were there when it was quite cool, but the pool and spa was very well heated... in the cool night you could see the steam come off the pool. The staff were always friendly and helpful, great loacation for shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A matter of taste”
Reviews.Author: pgwill
Reviews.Content: Recently modernised with spacious and comfortable 1 and 2 bedroom units, with kitchen facilities. Breakfast, evening snacks/drinks (sometimes dinner) and internet access are included in the price, although parking at $13 a day is not. This hotel is ideally going to suit families with a couple of children - the hotel has a pool, and is the right side of town for going to Sea World and the Zoo. It is also going to suit small groups of people looking for multi-occupancy units - for example, those going to Qualcomm Stadium, which is easy to get to. If you belong to one of these categories, you will likely be very appreciative of this hotel and probably rate it 4 or 5. Other travellers (including ourselves) will be less enthusiastic. If you like a hotel that is potentially reasonably quiet, the Residence will inevitably seem a bit noisy. Depending on your neighbours, it could be very noisy, although we noted that the sound insulation is reasonably good. I believe the hotel does a very good job in providing accommodation of a certain type. It is just not going to be to everyone's taste.

Reviews.Title: “Good for highway access”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBloke
Reviews.Content: Lovely staff, very friendly and helpful. Hotel is odd configuration as you have to exit the lobby to walk to separate building where the rooms are housed. Disappointed to no wireless in rooms. Rooms are very well laid out and clean. Not a place to stay if you like walking, it's next to highway. But driving distance to old town etc.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Molly F
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel for your visit to San Diego! It is in a great location (literally 10-20 minutes away from everything) and the staff, especially Brian, is extremely helpful and they follow up on requests as well as housekeeping. In fact, when we checked in, Travelocity had booked us the wrong type of room so Brian upgraded us to a more than comparable room without hesitation. It was spacious and very clean. Beds were comfortable and doors were quiet....did not hear any slamming in the mornings. Complimentary breakfast, beer & wine, and some nights even free dinner...wow! In today's economy, this really helped out my family of four to have an awesome stay and vacation there! Will be talking about this place to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Independent Buildings”
Reviews.Author: loves2laugh29
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Residence Inn and I was unfamiliar with the properties layout. There are multiple buildings on the grounds containing the rooms. Therefore your hotel room is not connected to the lobby/front desk. You have to go outside to reach the lobby and continental breakfast area. Overall the property was very nice. Nice pool area and very good cont. breakfast. There is no wireless internet in the rooms you have to plug in. We had one laptop that was not compatible and one that was. There are no vending machines on each floor only on the 2nd floor. We ordered more towels and they were delivered immediately. We had a two bedroom suite and it was very nice. There are fast food restaurants north of the hotel a couple exits but the good Mexican food is in Old Town San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and great location for Sea World/Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Browncoat_11
Reviews.Content: We've been very pleased with the staff as Residence Inns, but these folks were terrific. Tanya at the front desk was a particular standout. When she found out we were headed to Sea World, she gave us a coupon for a free child's admission and adult admission at the child's price. The coupon was not a typical hotel promotion -- it looked to be torn from a Happy Meal bag -- and we appreciated her thoughtfulness as much as the money we saved. We stayed in one of the two-room suites with the bunk beds. We were surprised and pleased to find that the bunk beds were very sturdy. There was no wireless internet in the room, but the cable connection was in a convenient place that could be used at the desk or on the couch. This was also the first hotel we've stayed at where our room had been prepared as feather-free in advance. Every other time, we have had to wait for housekeeping to be called and make the change. However, we stayed multiple days and the successive housekeeping visits changed the room back to feathered pillows which was frustrating. The only other complaint we had was that our fourth floor room was under an a/c unit or something else that made quite a loud, constant vibration sound in the kitchen/family area. However, since the noise could not be heard in either bedroom, we did not ask to be moved. The hotel just down the road from Old Town and within an easy 10 minute drive to Sea World. It's a good choice for travelers wanting to go to either site. We will definitely stay there the next time we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Sam D
Reviews.Content: The hotel had friendly staff, clean rooms and was in a great location for seeing San Diego. As with most Residence Inns, this hotel had a good breakfast and nice reception in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service...”
Reviews.Author: DaffodillMom
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here on a trip for 4 days. The hotel was great, wonderful service...Good breakfast buffet and the Sunday & Monday night social time with free wine and beer were fantastic. My only cons would be the stuffy/must scent on our floor (4th floor) which, I discovered was worst on the other floors and I also didn't notice any security cameras on the floors or in the parking lot. That was a bit odd.

Reviews.Title: “I feel at home!”
Reviews.Author: JessiJoeCarver
Reviews.Content: This is the most at home I've felt on travel in my life! The room is clean, modern, and has all the amenities that I need when I'm away for more than just a few days. The free breakfasts and dinners (Monday - Thursday) are great, equivalent to Applebee's for quality. The staff is always more than willing to go over and above with any need that one of my coworkers or I have. I never write reviews, but I love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jody A
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in a kids suite. Room was very spacious and looked like it had been recently renovated. The staff at the hotel were very helpful. This hotel is close to the zoo, Sea World and the airport. However, there is really nothing around the hotel within walking distance which was disappointing since we did not have a car. Seeing as we were in hotel circle, I assumed that there would be many restaurants and shopping nearby that we could walk to but that was not the case. There is good shopping and restaurants at nearby Fashion Valley Mall, but you must drive there. There is no shuttle service to zoo or Sea World from this hotel. There is a car service that hotel uses that was very good, but there was a cost every time we went somewhere. I would highly recommend this hotel if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel, Great Amenities, Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: Lillypond
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler for business and pleasure, I was pleasantly surprised at how wonderful this hotel was all around. My daughter and I stayed in a one bedroom suite which had two very comfortable queen beds, with updated bedding, an almost fully equipped kitchen (no oven) and a pull-out sofa bed in the suite area. There were two flat screen tvs and a desk for work space. The suite was very clean and we were provided extra towels and blankets on request. We ordered groceries for the week from Vons (Safeway) Supermarket which delivered them for free after we placed our order via the internet (free wifi in the rooms was a bonus). The daily breakfast buffet was expansive and many nights a light dinner meal was served. The front desk agents were extremely friendly and called on the day before our check out to inquire about our stay. I really enjoyed this hotel and my Pomeranian, Lilly enjoyed going for walks every day.

Reviews.Title: “It's great.will definitely stay in residence inns again!”
Reviews.Author: dwt8
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our 2 year old who still needs his nap so we spent a lot of time in the room. We got a suite which is best for our needs. The staff were great, it's very clean, it's nice.breakfast was nice but the light dinner wasn't so great but hey, it's free so no complaints there. Had a really pleasurable experience and holiday.!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gerald S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Residence Inn for 5 nights while we visited the attractions of San Diego. We had a two bedroom / two bathroom room which faced the pool. The room was very clean and the Kitchen with full size fridge was very handy. Marriott beds are famous for comfort and these did not disapoint. 3 TVs provided more than enough entertainment and the free high speed internet kept us in touch on e-mail and allowed us to research the local attractions. A small incident with housekeeping was quickly rectified by the front desk so service is definitely a proiority here. Thanks for a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service and nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: rainlvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Residence Inn from October 1st - 8th. It is a great hotel with renovated rooms that were very nice! We had a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom room and were very, very pleased with the cleanliness and set up. The beds were firm and comfortable with nice linens. Our room had 3 flat screen TVs (one in each bedroom and one in the living room). The only thing I would note is the wood cabinets in the kitchen probably need to be wiped down with cleaner a bit more frequently, but it wasn't terrible. Customer service is outstanding! We had problems with our TV and they came up immediately to fix it. Everything we asked for, they responded with a smile and were incredibly helpful! I do agree with another reviewer that the $13 parking fee seems excessive given the location of the hotel, and the fact that it's not in the downtown area. Breakfast was outstanding with hot and cold foods every day. They also have free dinners on weekdays (Mon - Thurs) that were excellent as well. We were all extremely happy with this hotel and would return and recommend it to our friends without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: chelmail
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near Old Town and the Fashion Valley Mall (which means it is near a transit station). The only two faults I can think of are the $13 parking fee per day which seems unreasonable in the area they are located and the fact that you have to walk through the king bed room to get to the bathroom. But neither was a deal breaker. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and accommodating. I received a friendly check in, with all information from Orbitz correct and they did not try to charge me again. Also the staff at breakfast was very attentive and helpful. The breakfast room was large with several seats and the food was filled frequently. They even had a reception in the bar on Sunday night with free wine and beer because of the Chargers game I presume. The suite we stayed in had bunkbeds in a small but large enough room with its own tv. (I should note here that the bottom bunk of the bed had very little head space.) The main room you walk in had a kitchen, table, desk (with ethernet cable), and a sofa bed with tv. Then their was a king bed in a separate room with access to a closet and bathroom. Sink was outside of the shower/toilet space. The kids also enjoyed the heated outdoor pool and hot tub. I would definitely recommend this place to families. We are a family of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed twice - first time better...”
Reviews.Author: trippy7882
Reviews.Content: Our first stay was very good - got an upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite and was pleasantly surprised by the complimentary evening meals/beer tasting. Breakfast was a full meal and well-done. Good access to USD and shopping areas. Everything functional and clean enough. Lots of families and busy pool area but good layout/space to accomodate everyone. Second trip was marred by smokers around the pool that management neglected to address. Complained twice but management ignored and let the smokers drive others away from the poolside area.... Room was clean, well-stocked and big enough but air conditioning in the bedroom was noisy and blew right on our faces in bed. Workout room equipment is okay and free internet/printer in the lobby. Lounge area off the lobby comfortable and good gathering place for groups/families. $13 day for parking.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints;”
Reviews.Author: cmpfigueroa
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I decided to spend the night in San Diego and we were pleasantly surprised how nice this Residence Inn is. It's right by the Old Town Historic State Park and very close to the Freeway as well from which several attractions of San Diego are just a short drive. San Diego itself is a very picturesque city and this hotel is indeed an additional asset. Beds are so comfortable, there's a small pool, there's a self-laundry machine, and free wired Internet. Parking I think is US$ 13 a day. Would recommend this hotel. Front desk staff are also wonderful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gokhale
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip and was happy with the accomodation. The room was comfortable and the breakfast buffet was plentiful. The only issue I ran into was the location - it is on the side of a hill off a frontage road. Parking could be a problem late at night. One night I could not get in the side access door because the door key would not work, and I had get in the main door. Fortunately, there is security access gate for the parking lot that makes it relatively safe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Huggles77
Reviews.Content: We recently visited San Diego and enjoyed our stay at the Residence Inn. We had a king suite with a comfy bed (but tight quarters in the bedroom), kitchen, and living room area. The hotel had a great breakfast each morning and afternoon snacks (during the weekdays only). The pool was fine, too. We had a bit of an issue with the air conditioning...it continuously ran (very cold) or it had to be turned off.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego trip during Power Outage 09/08/2011”
Reviews.Author: sandra m
Reviews.Content: I just want to say a BIG "THANK YOU" to the hotel Manager and staff there at the Residence Inn San Diego for a couple of nites we stay at there hotel. We arrived in San Diego about 130pm on the day the power outage happened. We checked into the hotel after 5pm and thinking we would not have anything to eat, the hotel served us dinner, hot dogs, ice cream,etc they kept us happy, they even had the first NFL game showing in there lounge. The whole staff was patience, respectful, and totally professional in our time of need. I also had other family members stay at the hotel too and they were very impressed with the manager and staff. We were traveling with our kids and they had plenty to do swimming, basketball, games, it was AWESOME. THANK YOU I definitely reccomend this outstanding 5 star hotel to everyone. Happy Travels The Miller and Dan Family from NM.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jayant S
Reviews.Content: we were party of six staying at Residence Inn. at first we thought price was little bit much but with all the amenities and comfort with great breakfast and evening light snacks this was well worth it. Then on sept. 8th there was power outage in all of San Diego and in time of stress, employee of the hotel were absolutely professional. Manager of the hotel kept us informed they kept food counter and drinks going and did bought all the ice cream they can get hold of in local grocery stores for the guest. All I can say is that the staff went above and beyond mine and every ones expectations and we feet secured and taken care off. Kudos to all of them and we will definitely stay there on our next visit and would recommend them without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Residence Inn - San Diego Mission Valley”
Reviews.Author: WCN_Portland
Reviews.Content: One of the most important items to me in choosing a hotel is the cleanliness. We arrived at the hotel around 6 PM, and went up to the room and I was disappointed to see that the table surfaces were sticky and had not been wiped down, there was lettuce and egg shells on the floor of the kitchenette, the carpets were stained, and the shower curtain was disgusting. I wiped down the tables, the floor, and then purchased an inexpensive shower curtain to use. However, apart from those few items, the stay was enjoyable. We were there during the power outage, and the manager did a fantastic job; he really did care about making his guests as comfortable as possible. All management was there until well past 10 PM, kept feeding the guests, barbecued burgers and hot dogs, kept the bar open, had a DVD playing for the kids, and gave out light sticks for the guests. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service during the 9/8/11 California power outage”
Reviews.Author: Jeff S
Reviews.Content: Please thank the entire staff at the hotel for a job well done last Thursday (9/8/11) during the massive power outage. The hospitality and level of service was absolutely outstanding. I felt very lucky to have been a guest at your hotel that particular evening.

Reviews.Title: “Power outage”
Reviews.Author: Mike122271
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels over the past 12 years I have been traveling for Best Buy and have never had a hotel be so accomidating to me when it was an issue out of their control. I will make sure to stay at this hotel again on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Black Out”
Reviews.Author: mbohs
Reviews.Content: A Co -worker and myself stayed at this property during the back out on Thursday. The staff was very professional and accommodating to all of their guest. They went above and beyond what I would have expected during the outage. I would recommend this Hotel and will be sending a more glowing email to Marriott. I was lucky to have stayed there. MJB

Reviews.Title: “POWER OUTAGE SAN DIEGO AREA 09/08/11-09/09/11”
Reviews.Author: Garry M
Reviews.Content: The staff did a great job when the power outage occured. The General Manager provided verbal updates on what was happending, and extended the normal food and refreshment services to the hotel guests. They showed the extra effort and concern that made the best of a bad situationl

Reviews.Title: “Professionalism during power failure”
Reviews.Author: ItBeMeEverywhere
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last night during the San Diego power failure. From the moment of check in to the following morning upon check out, the people here were very helpfull and made the long night in the dark as comfortable as possible. The best was a member of the staff was out in the lobby area answering questions, assisting in any issues that may arise with a lobby area full of people lingering around the lobby where they had emergency power to keep lights on and serve snacks to those that could not go out to eat, while the city was without power. This is why I continue to return to this location when in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Poweroutage on Sep 8, 2011.”
Reviews.Author: tomijack
Reviews.Content: We thought you did an excellent job at making the best of a bad situation. The generosity exhibited with the open bar, BBQ, popcorn, ice cream etc., was appreciated by all and I'm sure it will make for many memorable stories of the "Great San Diego Blackout of 2011" Thank you Tomi & Jack Windle

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time. Clean room. Staff wonderfully accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer K
Reviews.Content: Our room fit our family of 5 very comfortably! It was clean, beds were comfortable. Staff very friendly. Greeted with smiles and hellos all throughout the hotel! Breakfast had a ton of choices, eggs, sauage, yogurt, fruit, pancakes, cereals, biscuits with sausage gravy, french toast sticks, and lots more! We brought some of our own drinks and snacks and kept them in the fridge. When we had a challenging time using the computer in the business center, Courtney O was wonderful and had helped us try to figure out the problem with the computer. Then she let us use the hotel's computer to print out our Sea World tickets when the problem continued. We got to Sea World and had a blast! She would have printed out directions to anyplace we wanted to go in SD if we needed them as well! FYI- I don't know if Downtown is always a younger crowd hook-up scene, could've been Labor Day weekend or the ball game. We were shocked that our children were very uncomfortable and wanted to get out of there. Cabrillo National Monument with the Tide Pools is a must do with families! Very cool when the tide is low to see all the little crabs, snails, and shells. All kinds of things come in with the tide. Cool to see, only $5 to get in per car, and you can go back anytime for a week! We would definately stay at this hotel again. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DDDSSS123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great place to stay for families. The suites are a good size with a kitchen. You can grill your own food outside next to the pool on their large gas grill. The breakfast and evening hospitality buffet are a nice addition to your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and awesome employee's”
Reviews.Author: Chad S
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed staying at the Residence Inn Mission Valley, very nice rooms with lots of space and always clean. I really like the involvement of the staf,f hosting game night and being able to meet the people that keep the hotel a place you will always want to come back to. The only down side would have to be is the amount of families that stay with very loud children. But overall a great place, with a great sales team! I will stay again nexdt time i visit the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for families visiting Sea World & Zoo”
Reviews.Author: GranadaH
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a nice suite with separate bedroom/living room with well-equipped kitchen. The location is great for visiting Sea World & the zoo. We worried that our room location, on the first floor near the entry to the parking lot, would be too noisy, but it turned out to be just fine & convenient for taking stuff back & forth from our room to the car. The hotel was sold out at the time we stayed, which meant breakfast tended to be crowded & somewhat chaotic - they could use an expansion & better traffic pattern in the breakfast space. The food was fine, though. The hotel employees were very polite, though at times the front desk seemed under-staffed. The one time we used the pool (it was a late afternoon), there were no towels, and the staff at the front desk said they'd look into it but the towels never arrived. In general, it was a very good experience; the one real complaint I had was that the carpet in the room needed a good cleaning - especially in the entryway where it had lots of black marks. We didn't complain about it until the end because we just didn't want to take the time.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy for business stay...yet again.”
Reviews.Author: sadbuttrue
Reviews.Content: Originally had a reservation to stay at this place for 2 weeks for business trip but by day 7, enough was enough. Especially considering that I was going through the same problems that I had during my previous stay. I usually stay at a Residence Inn because of the suite and full kitchen even though you only earn half of the Marriott points. I can't stay at this one again even though it had just been renovated. I swear about 3 of 4 rooms had families with at least 3 kids which made getting breakfast and getting any work done in the room without hearing kids running up and down the hallway all through the night impossible. It was like anyone that was going to Sea World had to stay there. Internet was ok until 7pm when it slowed to below dial-up speed. Parking was at a premium, small spots, and not enough for every room. Took 45 minutes to get a single page fax out because the guy at the front desk barely spoke english and had no idea how to work the fax machine. They do give you soap and sheets for laundry at least.

Reviews.Title: “I continue to love this place”
Reviews.Author: joelstiles
Reviews.Content: The staff and the friendly environment make this hotel the best place to stay in San Diego. i have stayed here 7 times in the last 9 months and will keep coming back. The staff (Lilly, Shamar, Shelby, Laurel, Courtney) give the hotel a very friendly environment. It is the only hotel, and I have stayed at many, that has the most friendliest customer sevice at check-in. I really want to give a job well done to Shelby. Everytime I see her, she is always smiling, happy go lucky. And that creates an environment at the check-in area to give that first impression when people check-in a sense of pride for the Residence Inn. Keep up the good work. See you all in October.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to usually Marriott quality”
Reviews.Author: UALfrequentflyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residence Inn San Diego Mission Valley for 4 nights on 7/24. It was during the Comic Con convention and the hotel was packed. The location is close to freeway. Parking is secured but costs $13 per day. Check in was quick and room was available for early arrival. The one-bedroom suite was booked for 5 people but only 3 sets of towels were in the room. The suite was clean but the kitchen cabinets need intensive cleaning. Breakfast buffet was OK but the food area needs to clean up periodically especially when feeding so many people. Dine early as they sometimes run out of food choices. Even though everything is self service, the dining room tables need to be wiped down when someone finishes. There is a lack of service inside and outside dining area. Well after service is finished, dropped food can still be visible on the carpets or floors. One evening, a hotel guest bought in 5 or more boxes of pizza to be eaten around the pool area. The next morning, the empty pizza boxes were still sitting on tables around the pool area. Being a Marriott Elite member, I expect high quality and this hotel was well below average.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - we will absolutely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: travelingm0m2008
Reviews.Content: Hotel suite was gorgeous and spacious. Grounds were clean and well maintained. Check in was quick and staff was courteous and helpful. Parking lot gates and exterior door locks made the hotel feel safe. Excellent location, close to all San Diego attractions. Wonderful value.

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Needed”
Reviews.Author: gvwatts
Reviews.Content: My group of 5 girlfriends were headed for San Diego to visit the zoo. We were thrilled to find this facility which gave us just what we needed and included a free breakfast that would rival any in town. The suite that we got was very large. It had two separate bedrooms and two full bathrooms plus a fully equipped kitchen with modern appliances, including a dishwasher! Each bedroom and the sitting/dining area had its own TV, ample closet spaces and bathroom amenities (including hairdryers in each room) with great showers. One bedroom had a king bed, the other had two queen beds and the sofa in the sitting/dining area folded out into another bed. It was perfect for the five of us! The place has a lovely pool and a jacuzzi tub - great for tiring out the kids and ensuring a good night's sleep. The breakfast room was a very pleasant space, with a play area for smaller folk. Served buffet style, the food selection is more than adequate - cereals (including oatmeal), yogurt, fruit, scrambled eggs, bacon/sausage, breads, AND two waffle irons which cooked up the fluffiest waffles ever! All this was rounded up with a good selection of condiments and trimmings, tea, and coffee. What a deal! Again, just what we needed to get our group ready for our treks around the zoo. The Residence Inn does not have a restaurant on its premises; however, with its location on Hotel Circle South, restaurants were available in other locations along the strip of hotels. Better yet, it is an easy drive to Old Town San Diego where restaurants and shopping abound. Really, it was an easy drive from the hotel to most San Diego attractions and destinations. Staff at this hotel were most pleasant, accommodating, and very responsive to our needs. All five of us agreed that we would ABSOLUTELY stay here again!! Would we stay here again? ABSOLUTELY!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: momnlovingitinco
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Residence Inn San Diego Mission Valley/SeaWorld Area and found it to be very welcoming. On the day of arrival we checked in about 6:50pm. The front desk clerk told us to leave our car parked in temporary parking and go grab some complimentary dinner prior to it closing at 7pm. I thought this was very nice of her. The complimentary dinner on Mon-Thurs was a very nice touch and helped us to save money. The food was good - not fabulous, but good and filling. The free continental breakfast each morning was also a nice addition. The hotel was quiet and clean. Our children loved having their own room with bunk beds. And we loved having our own king size room! The pool and jacuzzi were warm. The exercise room did it's job. It had two elipticals, two treadmils and one stationary bike. I was hoping for free weights, but that is okay. We loved the fire pits and sat around them in the evening. Other patrons of the hotel were very friendly. Only downside, was the cleaning of the room. It just happened that each time they came to clean our room we had just got done swimming and were in the middle of getting dressed. The ladies weren't very happy that we wouldn't give them access to our room until we were ready to vacate. Oh, and parking...$13/day - not too high in comparison with other hotels you can stay at in the area. However, you had to use your room key to access the parking lot. I really felt like it was just another excuse to charge you more money. One last thing, hotel felt centrally located to many of the activities we chose to do. We would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but how do I get in?”
Reviews.Author: valint1
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed 3 nights at this hotel for our trip to Sea World in June of this year (2011). Check in was easy and the staff was nice and very attentive to any requests, although this hotel has a few things that need improvement in order to make it an excellent choice ...for possibly next time. First the very odd entrance structure. After arriving to the hotel we had unloaded our luggage on a cart at the entrance. After checking in we were given a map and directions to go back outside and drive around to access our room. We didn't know that we couldn't access our room from the lobby at arrival time and it was very awkward to try to find out how to get our luggage cart to our room without having to load it all back in the van and drive around. So we when we finished checking in we had to find an alternative route and we ended up rolling the full luggage cart out through the hotel entrance and through the pool area and then entered the building from the courtyard where our room was located and then finally up the elevator. So, later we found out how we actually had to drive around to the side of the hotel where access to our room was located and unload and enter from this side entrance. At these side entrances there was no official load/unload areas. Also, we had to manually open and hold the single entrance door, carry luggage on/over concrete steps, no ramps, no automatic doors, luckily there were five of us to all help each other. It was just such a strange and inconvenient entrance set up. Not to mention that all the parking spaces were very narrow and tight, and since there was not an official load and unload area at these side entrances you have to park in one of the spaces almost hitting the car next to you upon opening your car door and unload from your space unless you block other parking spaces to unload directly at the side door. Not sure if it was set up this way for security purposes but was very awkward and very inconvenient for a family of five on vacation. Once in the room we had to repeatedly request extra linens for the Sofa sleeper and towels as they provide enough for two to three people, when we had a reservation for five in our family. The sofa sleeper was not bad but was not good either. No fault of the hotel, but the sofa sleepers are just not comfortable so I slept on it so my children did not have to endure the uncomfortableness. The double beds were very comfortable. The hotel room and decor was very modern and clean. Kitchen was nicely updated with new stainless steal appliances, cabinets, and dishes. Although the paper towel holder in the kitchen is under the sink next to the trash can that looks grimy...wouldn't want to use the paper towels for eating purposes after seeing them on the roll holder next to the trash in a closed dark space. Paper towel rolls seem to be better left over the countertop. Also the bathroom had very poor ventilation and after showering much moisture would build and drip from the ceiling and walls. We actually tried to open a window just to help dry the condensation on the walls. Maintenance was callled once for a clogged bathroom sink drain. Again they were very attentive but took about 40min to fix. The breakfast was decent we had one morning when it was great and the other two it was not as great. The drive to Sea World was very close, maybe 5-10 min. In end, the good attentive customer service, clean, and modern decor made this hotel a pleasant stay, one that could have otherwise been completely undesirable.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Problems, Lobby looked and sounded like Day Care”
Reviews.Author: marycoug
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for a week and had a variety of problems. The best part of the property was the social hour in the 'complimentary sports bar' where you could escape the 'day care' atmosphere and the 20-30 young children in the lobby. We had elevator issues, there are not enough elevators and not all elevators go to all floors, so you spend a lot of time wandering around the halls to find the elevator that goes to your floor. Problems we can remember are: squeaky bed, thin walls, missing microwave platter, door wouldn't lock (had to be repaired), moved to smaller room but no reduction in room charges, A/C not working, soap/toiletries not replaced, request for non-feather bedding had to be made twice, ran out of food and juices at breakfast, exercise equipment monitors not working, cups not replenished at water cooler in work out room, etc... Management did correct most of the issues, but we just felt overwhelmed with so many issues and the lack of attending to details before the guest arrives. I can't recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: GiaMia
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked out perfect for our family of 4. We have a 3 year old and an 16 month old and having the kitchenette in the room was not only convenient but vital. The rooms are newly renovated, has a decent pool area with a BBQ/fire pit area and the breakfast that comes included is and unbelievable value. Which also has a kid friendly menu with a kids seating area with a DVD playing. While we were there it was Finding Nemo. Conveniently located to our destination which was Sea World and also to Target. Overall nice, clean, quiet hotel and a great value! Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: motherofthree73
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights there and loved it. The rooms were spacious and clean and the staff were friendly and accommodating. I would highly recommend this place...

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating...”
Reviews.Author: CorkyBBagilbert
Reviews.Content: Located on Hotel Circle, this is one of the nicer establishments. The hotel is located very close to many of the major San Diego attractions. It's clean and the staff is quite friendly. Although the price might be slightly higher than some of the surrounding hotels, you need to take into account that breakfast and dinner is included, as well as a happy hour every evening. They have a very nice BBQ area out by the pool that can be used by guests. We had forgotten plates, bowls and utensils and management provided us with everything. They even turned on the soda machines for us! They also have a DVD/viewing area for kids and a pool table, foosball table and game room It's a very safe and comfortable environment and I would reccommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, free breakfast, just renovated!”
Reviews.Author: jagUtah
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from the 11th of July 2011 through the 15th. We had to call the hotel for various things like requesting a crib for the room before we arrived and the staff was very friendly on the phone. When we arrived they were just as friendly in person as they were on the phone. The hotel has just gone through a renovation and it looks a lot nicer than the pictures they have posted on their web site (I have attached some pictures of our room). My only complaint was the carpet was in need of a cleaning. The greatest thing about this hotel is the free breakfast and hospitality hour at night. We have two kids, and it was great not having to worry about breakfast. The breakfast consists of waffles, eggs, bagels, oatmeal, cereal, jucies, milk, etc. The hospitality hour was hot dogs, potato bar, tacos, then pasta on each of the nights. Negatives about this hotel is the $13 parking per night, and the pool was a little small. The pool wasn't ever busy when we stayed here so it wasn't ever crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: Cocohead32
Reviews.Content: Five of my family members stayed in the 2bdrm/2ba suite. It was like being at home. Suite was spacious and clean. There were 3 TVs. One in each bedroom and one in the living area. The kitchen was nice to have too. Took advantage of the free dinner and breakfast. The dinner was spaghetti, salad, and bread. Breakfast was eggs, sausage, waffles, and lots of other items. Also free beer and wine. Saves a lot of money to not have to buy meals. Seemed to be very much a family hotel. Lots of children. Lots of parking, but spaces are small. Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for 10 days and loved every minute !!!”
Reviews.Author: handyman80
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 10 days, and loved every minute!!!! Hotel was spotless, bed comfortable, spa and pool were awsome, dinind room great, Free breakfast every morning, coffee, newspapers, ect. Every nithe on the weekdays also had free dinner, tacos, pasta, etc, nothing fancy but adequate, and very delicious!! On Memorial Day Satruday they cooked up brats and hotdogs on the large outside grills that were also available for guest use. Outside fireplace was also nice and took advantage of it a couple of nites. Computers in lobby were available 24/7 to look up attractions and print info and directions, but staff was also always available to give suggestions, and directions. Minor problem:: the living room was too packed with furniture which made the room seem too small but this did not take awa from our wonderful experience. The one nite we came in late and there was no parking place, the staff immediatly had us park in one of the check in spots(10 min parking only) which was far away from our room, but they deducted the parking fee for the nite from our billl! All staff were pleasant and nice to talk to, and always made us feel like we were the only ones there! WOULD STAY AGAIJN IN A HEARTBEAT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: FamOf3_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May 2011 with our 5-year-old and it was everything we needed. Extremely close to attractions in or near the downtown area (not as convenient to North County, but take the Pacific Coast Highway and the drive is so beautiful you won't mind). It sits on a busy highway access road amid a cluster of other hotels and motels, so you'll need a car to get to shopping, dining and more scenic areas. Our room was newly renovated, quiet, bright and clean. When we reserved it, we made sure to specify a full wall and door between the bedroom and the living area, where our son would be sleeping on the pullout sofa (*very* grateful to the agent who told me that some rooms only have partial privacy walls between the two). That was a lifesaver in allowing us to stay up and read, chat or watch a movie after he went to bed. The bed itself was extremely comfortable. We didn't use the kitchen extensively, but it was equipped with all the basic tools to cook a full meal. We loved having the full-size fridge for snacks, drinks and takeout leftovers and a dishwasher to clean out water bottles, etc. The buffet breakfast is pretty standard (make-your-own waffles, eggs, cereals, pastries, etc.) - we ate breakfast in nearby Mission Beach a couple of times for a little more variety. On weekdays a light dinner buffet is available. We didn't sample most of it, although we did take advantage of things like cheese and crackers and carrot sticks to tide us over before heading out to dinner. The pool area is pleasant and includes a hot tub and grills. The onsite laundry facilities were a nice plus (bring quarters!) and meant that we could pack half as much clothing as normal, wash and re-wear. The only negative is that the pool and laundry room are both a little hard to access from some areas of the hotel; you have to figure out which elevators will and won't get you to the wing you need to be in. Fortunately, the front desk staff is courteous and helpful in pointing guests in the right direction. Do be aware that the hotel is pet-friendly, if allergies or other concerns might sway you. We didn't have any problems with barking dogs, etc. Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel, especially for families. We'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best. We will be back”
Reviews.Author: kamaki49
Reviews.Content: Close to work and eateries. Great accomodations, clean, great staff. Only improvement would be a better workout room and equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Price, Location, and Overall Value.”
Reviews.Author: Gearheadcom_Brandon
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in this hotel and the overall value was great. The location was great to everything, the price was very affordable and the best part of the hotel for a family of 5 was the breakfast. You will not be disappointed and it is all included. We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: atlantic2580
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights while on business and had a good stay. Hotel was located off the interstate; a few minutes from Sea World and the zoo. They had just renovated the hotel, so it looked modern and fresh. Parking was $13/day. I requested a top floor corner room and was given one. However my room faced the interstate, so there were some car noise. Hotel was situated far away from the interstate, but it maybe a problem for light sleepers. Room had just be renovated and had new bedding and furniture. I was given a family suite that had a master bedroom and kid's bedroom with bunk beds. Kitchen had stainless steel appliances and there were 2 LCD TVs. As with other Residence Inns, they offered free breakfast and evening socials. The breakfast was nice with hot foods such as sausages, eggs, potatoes. The evenings socials were a big hit for me. It was convenient and I didn't have to spend money to go out to eat. They had hot dogs the first night; tacos the second night; and pasta the third night of my stay. Beer was free as well. Overall this was one of the better Residence Inns. It is perfect for business and leisure trips.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Confusing Layout”
Reviews.Author: 1NicePerson
Reviews.Content: When you arrive at this hotel and park on the side or rear of the building ($13/night) you find yourself on the 2nd floor. Two elevators go serve floors 1-4 only and one secret elevator (not on the diagram at the front desk) serves 1-5. My room was on 5 and it was quite an adventure finding it. And the lobby and breakfast/dinner area is a standalone building. I know it never rains in Southern California but when it does, be prepared to get wet just going to breakfast or the front desk. At least they could have an awning to keep you dry. Breakfast was OK as were the afternoon snacks although I have seen a lot better at other Marriott properties. But with a friendly staff and convenient location, this place is OK, especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “Trip with family to San Diego Zoo - Perfect for family stay”
Reviews.Author: Buddynutnut
Reviews.Content: Purpose of this trip was to take our baby daughter to SD Zoo, so we chose this hotel because of the kitchenette, and the east of location. Pro : -Staff was really good. We wanted to get extra towels for the room, they got it to us in a hurry. We also asked for a hairdryer since the one in our room was not available, a staff brought it to us in less than 5 minutes. Courtesy call was nice to insure that we received what we asked for. I could not find any fault with the staff... better than most 4 star rated hotels we've stayed at. - Room was quiet. We were afraid to stay near the railroads like last time, so we chose this area to be at. It was pretty quiet, with the exception of some running from the lobby. There was some sort of basketball tournament in the area, and the hotel was filled with teenagers. But this didn't detract from how quiet the room was. - Another wonderful kitchenette. Bathroom was clean, bed nicely done. The only thing was the sink area.. right under the sink, there is a faux cabinet that it looks like someone tried to yank out before. No biggy, just don't touch it. We mentioned it to the staff up front. - Breakfast was very nice. More food than we could expect. Baby liked the scramble eggs. Good enough for baby, good enough for us. Con : There wasn't many things we can nitpick... but here are some - The sign is tiny. Residence inn is next to the Extended Stay. All the other hotels were easily visible, but this sign was tiny. - Pillow was a bit hard. This is more of a personal preference than anything, but still, the pillow was hard for me. No big deal, I don't really find it a fault of the hotel though. I just use some of the extra towels as pillows. - Parking stated $13 on one brochure when you check in. On the Map brochure of the hotel it says $10. Nevertheless paying for parking is blah. It's nice to have in and out privileges, but to pay extra for this is blah. Summary : We would stay here again. Perfect for families with children. Lots of convenient locations in the area... easy access to freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ElPaso_TexasAngel
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, roomy, and organized. Upon checkin, staff provided directions to grocery stores, Target, etc. in the area, which was very helpful while toting small children! Location was great, very close to Sea World!!! Onlly negatives were no fitness center (very important to me!) and a charge for parking...

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Great Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: firsttimeinSAN
Reviews.Content: There can be issues at any hotel, what I loved about this hotel was that requests and issues were responded to very quickly and professionally. But, just to warn you, if you travel with family you will enjoy it, if you travel for business, maybe not so much! Also they need to change sheets more frequently, or beds are going to stink in a near future! They wont change it unless you request; which I didn't realize or pay attention until the last day that i was packing our stuff to get ready to leave, when i found the sign advising to put it on bed if you want the sheets changed! Oops! Too late. All in all it was great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Makes you feel at home, even though your away.”
Reviews.Author: joelstiles
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at several San Diego hotels, Residence Inn Mission Valley goes to the top of my list. With the courteous Staff (Tawny, Jo, Shamar, Shelby, Courtney, Lindsey, and even the manager Todd), this hotel makes me feel at home. Keep up the good work and I will continue to see you guys monthly.

Reviews.Title: “The best extended stay hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: adm793
Reviews.Content: Myself and 4 other coworkers stayed at the hotel from 3/20-4/22. During the first couple weeks of the stay the hotel was completing a massive renovation. Other than a couple of areas being blocked off for the guests safety and seeing the workers during off hours, it was never an inconvenience. Being a returning guest, the renovation brought much needed changes. The rooms now have updated stainless steel appliances, new carpet, wall coverings, furniture, beds, and the best addition, Flat Panel TVs. Wireless internet in all of the rooms would be nice, but they do provide a patch cable for access to the free internet in every room. The hotel also has many other great features that added to the stay. The breakfast is real food every morning (not just pastries and coffee). Make sure to get down stairs early on the weekend or you will be eating with a crowd of other guests. Make sure to try out the waffle maker, best waffle you will ever eat. Dinner with dessert was served Monday-Thursday. A couple times they served soup on back to back nights (almost asked the staff if I could make a waffle), but the free beer (not the watery stuff, brews like Shocktop, Stella, and Long Hammer on tap) and wine more than made up for the soup. If you have the time, I recommend that you take the time for the manager night activities on Thursday night, whether it is Karaoke, Poker, Bingo, or Smores on the fire pit, the hotel staff always makes sure the activity is fun and there is the potential for Marriott points to be won by the guests...Also, if you like to Grille, they have two that are available for guests. You just have to request use and they will supply the gas, spatulas, and even light it up for you. The hotel is also within walking distance to Old Towne San Diego and 15-20 minute drive to downtown or the attractions. I recommend that you check out the Cosmopolitan for a dressier dinner (best food in Old Town) or hit up Fred's or Cafe Coyote for the drinks and above average Mexican food. Just expect a long wait if going out on Taco Tuesday... Overall, the stay was the most fun I have had on a business trip in a long time. Every single person on the staff was courteous, professional and would also engage in casual conversations (often needed when out of town for a long period of time with the same 3 people). I have been coming to the hotel since 2004 and plan to go back next time I have business in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxing get away”
Reviews.Author: Happyallover
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Residence Inn by Marriott in San Diego was an extension of being at my own home. Pleasant surroundings, well kept rooms, friendly employees, great breakfast choices, centrally located near the heart of Downtown San Diego, easy freeway access, leaving and returning to the Hotel. I will stay again at the Residence Inn on my next trip to San Diego; due to the recent upgrades of the rooms and the lobby area, created a fresh look for the Inn. I have attached a couple of photos showing how organized the kitchen area is and the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “The best staff of any Marriott Property I have stayed with!”
Reviews.Author: HicksDavid
Reviews.Content: I am frequent traveler. Actually, I travel more than anyone I have ever met. I am on an average of 4 to 6 flights every week and stay at least 250 nights in hotels every year. I try to stay in Marriott properties (although I stray on occassion based on locality). This property made me feel so "at home" and comfortable that I felt it was necessary to write a review. The front desk staff, kitchen staff, housekeeping, maintenance, and management team were all extremely friendly and helpful. On Wednesday evening they hosted an outdoor bar-b-que which was more like a friendly disney resort experience than a typical Marriott stay. The breakfast was impressive every morning with quite a layout! And the location was a bonus. Quick and Easy access to North, South, East, and the beach. I have stayed at other area Full Service Marriotts, Courtyards, and Hyatts, but in all my future travels to San Diego, I will be staying with this property! I highly recommend this property to anyone traveling to San Diego County. David Hicks

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like a 2nd Home”
Reviews.Author: RAN22
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this place for years. I am a Platinum Premier Marriott rewards member and can honestly say you can't expect to get much more than what they provide. The breakfast is more than what you get at a typcial Residence Inn and the social hour during the week can't be touched by other hotels. Believe me, I've had the "nacho's" (tortilla chips and cheese whiz) that most RI's say is their evening fare and they can't compete....this place provides full meals most days. The staff is fantastic and treat you like a friend and not just another face coming into the hotel! If you have a problem, they will go out of their way to fix it. The renovations look great and provide a fresh new look to the hotel along with nice upgrade to the TV's in each room.

Reviews.Title: “A it disappointing for a Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: caryon1
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott Platinum member so I have a good bit of background for comparison purposes. We are a family of 5 so we often stay at the Residence Inn's We travel on vacation. This one needs some work. They are beginning a remodeling, which is good. The staff attitude is average. The room we reserved was not available and they did accomodate us to our satisfaction but not without a lot of pushing from me. The hotel is a bit noisy - walls are probably too thin. The location is very good for anything you want to do in San Diego. You will need to drive to all of the attractions but most are within 5 miles. The breakfast was good. Parking is $10/night which isn't bad but I think a lot of the adjacent hotels are free. I probably wouldn't stay here again but its not the worst place in the world. Value for what we paid was reasonable, but there are better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you don't mind hearing people around you.”
Reviews.Author: REEMaryland
Reviews.Content: First note: this hotel is undergoing renovations. They are upgrading the rooms throughout Spring 2011. The renovations did not impact me except that the contractors were using a number of parking spaces. The gym was closed during my stay, but they offer use of a nearby gym. Location: Hotel Circle South is a strip of hotels/motels. There's nothing interesting within walking distance and there isn't much of a view. You will need a car. On the other hand, the freeway is very convenient and the area is a short drive to Sea World, Old Town, Balboa Park/Zoo, shopping, and the airport. Downtown and La Jolla are also quite close. Check-in: Very quick; received early check-in without a problem (I arrived around 2 PM, not very early). Rooms: the 2-queen 1-BR suite is a generous size. The bedroom is crowded, with 2 queen-sized beds, but there is room for luggage; with the living room area, the whole suite is comfortable. The room was clean although it showed a little age (I was in an unrenovated room). In-room wired internet was free. It didn't work when I first arrived, but they had it fixed fairly promptly. The big problem was sound isolation. Although the bedroom door does a good job of blocking hallway noise, you can hear neighbors above and through the shared wall. Even a simple phone conversation is pretty clear. I've stayed in hotels with thinner walls, but not many. Unfortunately, there's not much the hotel management can do. They can only ask people to quite down if security can hear them from the hall and you can hear through the the shared wall better than through the two doors between the hall and the bedroom. The bed was comfortable and there were plenty of pillows. I can't report on the HVAC. I didn't need heat or AC while I was there (not unusual for San Diego).
