Reviews.Content: I was concerned about our stay after reading the reviews. My husband and 2 boys (ages 5 & 9) stayed here for 2 nights on June 7th & 8th. I was pleasantly surprised with the service from the staff. The room was as to be expected and the beds were not that comfortable, especially after staying at the West Inn and Suites the night before. On Thursday, there was a great happy hour because the Padres were playing the Dodgers. They had a hot dog and hamburger bar, nacho bar and salad bar. They also were giving out little soft baseballs to my sons and a Padres glass to my husband. The next morning at breakfast, they gave our son's a cute take home cup with animals on it (the kind you get with the kid's meal at the zoo or seaworld). That afternoon we were at the pool and the hostess walked around giving away ice cream sandwiches to the people enjoying the pool and blow up beach balls to the kids at the pool. I think they have gone above and beyond any hotel that we stayed at during our trip. We didn't experience any loud noise. We were on the 2nd floor facing the pool. I would stay here again and I would recommend it to my friends. The location is convenient to Sea World, the Malls and the airport, however you do need a car.

Reviews.Title: “Will not go back, not what we expected for a Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: CACALovetotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for an overnight stay. Our two room suite was $350, which is a little steep for the size of the suites. It was very difficult to navigate through the hotel, because one elevator only goes to floors 2-5, then you have to take a different elevator to the 1st floor. The hallways were noisy at 1am, with people in the halls and elevators. During breakfast, because the hotel was sold out that weekend, the staff was a little slow keeping butter, bread, etc. stocked. The toaster machine was not working properly, so as a result I had to stick my hand all the way to the back to retrieve the toast and burned my hand on the machine. This is very dangerous considering how many people were using this toaster overn. When the front desk was notified of the situation, I was told that the manager would be informed, and I was given mustard to apply to my burn because the first aid kit was not stocked that day for anything for burns. I was very disappointed with the quality of this particular hotel. I expected more from Marriott, but I think it is because they are just so busy. On my next visit, I will consider another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, poor location, noisy”
Reviews.Author: runtom
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, but South Hotel Drive is a poor location if you enjoy walking or running from your hotel. You really need a car. Parking is $10/day. There's a Tram stop about 1.5 miles away at Fashion Valley Mall, but you have to know how to get there. The Town & Country Resort across the freeway is a nicer property with a better location, but they don't have suites. Our King Suite was fairly large. The hide a bed was uncomfortable. Kitchen was well equipped and included an electric stove top, microwave, dishwasher, full size refrigerator, pots and pan, glasses, plates, knives, silverware, paper towels, coffee, salt & pepper, etc. Gas grill available near pool. Breakfast buffet included eggs, sausage, waffles, bread, fruit, cereal. Free newspapers--WSJ, USA Today, SD Tribune. Saturday WSJ not available. Large desk and free high speed internet were nice features. Other than cheap scratchy bath towels, my only complaint was the noise level. Sound insulation is very poor. Conversations and TV in adjacent room and hallway were disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: No_Roaches_Please
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week on business. I was very impressed with this hotel. It was very clean, had a nice size kitchen with a nice little dining area, separate living room area that was sectioned off with a door from the bedroom. Desk for working was very good and the internet access was excellent (which was very important for working afterhours). A/c was able to be digitally regulated so I was able to keep the room ice cold all the time. Bed was very comfortable and the sink, bathroom and shower were all very good. The living room, desk, table, chairs and kitchen was pretty spacious...but the bedroom was not. There was a problem opening the bedroom door all the way and the dresser was too close to the beds, which caused you to turn sideways to get through. The hotel staff was one of the best in my traveling experience. Front desk was very helpful and housekeeping skills were top notch. Room was cleaned up each day, they did not turn down my A/c settings and they even washed my dirty dishes. There are some drawbacks. The hotel is in Hotel Circle, which is very close to downtown and Seaworld...etc, but you need a car. There is nothing in walking distance and any late night snacks were about 6 minutes away at the 24 hour supermarket. Parking at the hotel was good if you were staying there. Visitor parking virtually did not exist. The walls are thin, so sealing out noise is hard, but it was not too noisy that week so it was not much of a factor. Just a few minutes here and there listening to someone else's Tv from time to time. Overall...I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great EXCEPT the room!”
Reviews.Author: KellyJones34
Reviews.Content: The property, pool, breakfast and location are great. When a party fired up downstairs at 11pm, a quick call to the desk and they were evicted. However, we couldn't even fully open the door to our suite bedroom as it ran into the bed. The room was REALLY small for a suite and not what we're used to from a Residence Inn. When I asked the desk about it they told me it "might" be a smaller room than normal. "Might???" No offer to move us, no offer to even check it out. Pretty pathetic and we won't be back because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but you do need a car.”
Reviews.Author: WelshLorna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights the end of October. The room was really nice. We had a bedroom with two queens,a nice sized lounge and a full kitchen. Just right for a family of 4. The pool area was nice. The jacuzzi very warm. The pool area did not get a while lot of sun at this time of year though. The hotel circle area where this hotel is situated is not in the most scenic area. You are right off interstate 8. This hotel however is sey back from the road. rooms at the rear overlook the pool and there is no traffic noise what so ever. There are no restuarants at all within walking distance. There are a number of family restuarant chains and fast food restuarants 5 minutes drive away in Sports Arena Boulevard. Sea world is a 10 minute drive away max. Target 5 minutes in the other direction. Fashion Valley Mall is 3 minutes drive away. Breakfast is plentiful. We only tried the managers reception once . There were snacks and beverages between 5pm and 7pm free of charge. The snacks change nightly and range from potato skins to soup and salad. My first impression of the hotel was not that good because of the busy freeway so close. After a day or so in the hotel my opinion changed once I realised how close we were to everything. Overall we liked the hotel and would probably stay at it again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “good for families”
Reviews.Author: mary001
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and enjoyed our stay. Pros: Clean room(with separate kitchen, living and sleeping area), good service and breakfast is good and adequate. Con: The noise from the pool. We requested an upper floor, and the noise can barely be heard. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “4th visit to this property, but with problems this time...”
Reviews.Author: Shaney G
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th visit to this property, in the last two years or so, and we never had any problems with the service or facilities before. But this time, the front desk had problems with finding available rooms for us, despite making reservations, six months previous. We checked-in about 2:00 pm and Brandy or Brenda at the front desk told us to come back a little after 3:00 pm, because the rooms weren't ready. We came back at 4:00 pm and our room was still not ready, despite two guests ahead of us receiving their room keys with no problems. Our room request was nothing special, but just your basic one bedroom suite. After finally running a print out of the available rooms, Brandy gives us our room keys to suite #147. Low and behold the toilet didn't flush. We call the front desk at 4:50 pm (Oct 7th), Brandy informs us that she will call buidling maintenance to check the toilet out. One hour later at 6:00 pm, no one still does not show up. We call Brandy and she says, "ooh I taught it was fix, the maintence person said, he just fixed it" Of course we respond that no has showed up yet. At about 6:20 pm, a "angry" maintenance person knocks on our door and mumbles something and proceeds to the toilet. After about 5 minutes, he walks out without saying a word. We assumed he fixed the toilet and obviously he did. We will probably be back to this property again and hope the above incidents were only a one-time bump in the road, but for the price you pay for suites and parking here, you expect the service to be a little better than the motels down the street. SGS 10.13.06

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Mary...we enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: mom-o-five
Reviews.Content: We were very unhappy with the Comfort Inn and wanted to check out. We called directly to Residence Inn and were greeted by a very kind and helpful front desk clerk "Mary" who saved us. I can't tell you how nice it was to be treated professionally and humanely. We stayed in a two-room King with bunk beds in the other room and a fold out in the living area. The only thing I wished is that the bathroom was either central to the room or there was a half bath...anyway. It was the first night I slept through the night because of the comfort of the bed. Down comforter and pillows felt like home. The kitchen was nice and had a regular sized refrigerator. 3 TV's were nice for our family of 6. The pool was nice and the jacuzzi great. Breakfast was wonderful with some hot foods, 4 waffle makers (whipped topping and strawberry sauce), fresh fruit and yogurt and the usual continental fare. The laundry facilities were nice with 4 washers and dryers and secured with room key lock. They had a little store that was overpriced but not any more than a convience store. There was a small game room off the pool and breakfast area. Everyone at this hotel seemed to be having a good time and the atmosphere was a happy one. Kids were running around and I saw a lot of generational families that must have been vacationing together. There was a $10 charge for parking but it was closed off at night with an arm accessible by room key. The two room suite cost $179 but a very bad suite at Comfort Inn was going to cost us $229 so I think we made a good choice. The only drawbacks were the lack of fast food in proximity to Hotel Circle...are you listing Wendy's? It is easy to get to Sea World, San Diego Zoo, Balboa, and Old Town (especially) but there is no shuttle or transport. Again...is anyone listening? Two streets of hotels and no shuttle?

Reviews.Title: “Got kids? Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Soon2Moon
Reviews.Content: Our family of four thoroughly enjoyed our vacation at this Residence Inn-Mission Valley July 24th -27th. (We also stayed at the Catamaran Resort & Spa the 27th - 30th, which I will post a review on soon.) The Residence Inn is one of the newest hotels in Hotel Circle and we were very pleased we booked here instead of the other places we saw in that area once we arrived. This Residence Inn is nestled up against the hillside, off of the main road, enough so that we didn't hear any traffic noise whatsoever. Our first impressions were good considering the talk of the general Hotel Circle area and it being situated right next to 1-8 weren't very positive. However, it turned out we were in a great location in terms of getting to and from Old Town (which we loved!), Sea World, beach, banks, shopping, restaurants, etc. and we felt safe. We rented a car, which is necessary IMHO, so getting out and around wasn't an issue. We found it very easy to navigate our way around this area and San Diego in general. The front desk here was very helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations. Even printing out directions to any place we wanted to go. We arrived very early so our room was not ready...Not a problem. The front desk staff still checked us in, took our luggage, and gave us pool keys so we could enjoy the amenities. Nice pool and game rooms for the kids. Our requests for an upper level room overlooking the pool was granted. Our room was immaculate! Full kitchen w/ all the bells and whistles. Our maid even loaded our dishwasher for us one day, which I never expected! The beds were comfortable to us also. Note: the walls are thin and you can hear (somewhat faintly) conversations. The complimentary daily buffet breakfast and early evening snack and drink social was really good and a nice touch! I would recommend you get down to the lobby before 8:00 AM as the breakfast rush hits about then and the buffet lines are long and tables can become scarce. We are early risers so it wasn't an issue for us to get up a bit earlier to avoid the hubub. It was booked FULL with families & children of all ages when we were there and the pool also became packed by 3:00 PM every day. The pool area has a wading pool which is perfect for toddlers, an average size 4 1/2 ft deep main pool plus hottub. Our teens enjoyed it as we visited w/ other families around the pool during the evening socials. We did hang out one day on Coronado Island at the Hotel Del Coronado, which is beyond fabulous!! Get directions and go visit to take in the beauty of this area for great shopping, restaurants and beautiful beaches. We also highly recommend a visit and tour of Old Town. Literally, this area is 5 minutes away from the Residence Inn Hotel. We ate our way through there- the first night at El Agave (which is wonderful mexican cuisine), toured the Historic Whaley House and shopped. Very fun and interesting so don't miss this place since it's close by! Residence Inn-Mission Valley Sea World is an ideal place for families with young children to stay at. The price is right, it's very clean, close to most attractions and provides a family w/ home- away -from- home amenities.

Reviews.Title: “it's new and OK...but pricey for that location”
Reviews.Author: likes_travel_3323
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 4 nights. July 16-20. It's a nice hotel. clean. modern. etc but pricey for that area. more info follows, some has been said before but included so that we reenforce positives and negatives: Good: breakfast buffet included. hot breakfast,eggs, cereal, waffle irons. etc. clean modern room. decent space. Kids suites give a nice parent/kid separation although it was very weird that the only bathroom in that room type is inside the parent room so the kids have to go through your room to get to it.. Free basketball and volleyball area. good game rooms for kids. BAD: thinnest hotel walls ever experienced. i swear we could hear people in the next room breathing. had non-smoking room but smoke smell from smoking rooms wafted in . needed to run a/c ro keep the smell out. also 10 dollars a night to park! ridiculous. for that area. parking spaces EXTREMELY small. I am not kidding. I can park anything anywhere but in this place when its sold out you need a shoehorn to get out of your car. Area: very convenient to SeaWorld. Also near some decent malls. not too far from other major San Diego areas ( coronado island, La Jolla, petco park etc all within a reasonable car ride) Generally good for what it is but not worth the rates ( AAA rate of 249 plus that 10 bucks a night parking fee) Other were paying higher (319, etc) The whole hotel circle area is considered more reasonable and family freindly but for that money an extrea hundred a night might easily get you to a much nicer area if the budget allows.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just stayed one night at the Residence Inn San Diego Mission Valley/Sea World Area, June 24-25, 2006. The hotel room was clean and spacious. Our 2 year old enjoyed the second bedroom with bunk beds that we didn't expect. The biggest draw back is the noise. You can hear everyone around you. The walls are very thin. The breakfast is good. Many items to choose from, hot and cold and fresh fruit. We did feel safe at the hotel. We didn't feel all that safe at the local outdoor mall. And we are from LA. Pool was fine too. Overall, I wouldn't stay again. For the price, I would rather stay near the beach next time.

Reviews.Title: “all the great reviews were true!”
Reviews.Author: nrh
Reviews.Content: I'm always a little worried when I book a hotel that has tons and tons of great reviews. I have this image in my head of somebody at the hotel getting paid to sit at a computer and write reviews all day long! We've been bitterly dissapointed in the past. That was so NOT the case at the Marriott Residence Inn. We showed up about 6 hours before check-in time hoping they might have a room for us and they did. The free breakfast was great and they did a super job of keeping things clean even with a lot of little kids running around. Because there were a lot of people there for long stays, everybody seemed to treat the community areas more like they would their own homes and tended to pick up after themselves which helped too. My kids loved playing pool and pingpong in the gameroom. They also made good use of the basketball court and the pool. The laundry room came in handy too! The staff was super nice to us and the kids. They had tons of sheets of good directions handy to area attractions. When it was time to check out, they even printed out a mapquest route to our next hotel! Our kids' suite room was a very comfortable set up. The bunkbed idea is great. I don't know why more hotels don't do that! It was also great that they had a full compliment of dishes (and a dishwasher so I didn't have to handwash!!). They only thing I'd change would be to add an additional entry to the bathroom or another bathroom so the kids didn't have to walk through the masterbedroom to go potty. We got woken up a lot by the toilet flushing. All in all, we thought we got a great value and although this hotel didn't have a view of anything other than a freeway, it was very centrally located to everything we wanted to do. We'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Live4DaysOff
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and I would have to say the thing that stood out the most was the pleasant staff at breakfast. The previous postee was not kidding when she said they clean up your spills before you can say, "boo". My toddler spilled and they were there in a jiffy, they refilled our coffee and rushed over with more napkins when I was feeding my other child. They were on top of things and so nice. They made us feel so welcome. The food was very good but I was dissapointed there was no gravy for the bisquits. There is quite a selection though and chocolate milk for kids is quite a treat when you can take an extra one to put in the fridge in your room for later. The nightly manager dinner was nice too but we only made it one night. They had corn dogs one night with potato salad and green salad and drinks and then the second night was mac and cheese but we didnt make it back in time from seaworld and shopping. It can really help with the budget though if you have more than one kid! The arcade was nice but not free. The pool looked nice but we didnt have much time. There were some kids in there but not too many to make it look unwelcoming. The rooms-the bed was more comfy than the embassy suites in anaheim but not what I would call super comfy. The room was dark enough for us to sleep in and the doors did not creak to wake the kids when someone used the restroom which was nice. The room was VERY clean, the bathroom was great and the kitchen was the perfect size. We watched a movie one night (free HBO)and hung out and the living room area was not crowded (it's smaller than the picture appears). It was very relaxing to be in a clean, safe hotel with no traffic noise. We would stay again. The ONLY negative-narrow parking for big pickup trucks or SUVs and parking lot set up hard to get luggage to car since parking lot in back is up hill. If you have a compact car you can park closer and it should be fine. The parking anywhere in a big city is tight so what can we expect? Thank you Residence Inn for being so friendly and making us feel welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Darn Near Perfect”
Reviews.Author: woodstork
Reviews.Content: Thank you, Tripadvisor, for again referring us to a marvelous place to stay. The suite was bright and fresh with ample room for cooking. Both the bed and the sofabed were comfortable, the bed exceptionally so, and for any sofabed to be comfortable is unheard of. Having fresh colors in the room truly made a difference from the same-ole'-blah-drab of most motel rooms - made it still restful, but a little more lively. The room was incredibly quiet - the motel is set back farther against the mountain from the road than most other of the motels there, and is quite soundly constructed. The only noise we ever heard was due to a funny indiosyncracy - when one first turns on the TV's they are set at a high volume and need to be turned down immediately. Other than that, all was silent, and drapes plenty dark enough to allow jet lag adjustment. I don't usually resort to caps, but the breakfast was OUT OF THIS WORLD! Here's what you get every morning, in a big, lovely, open, spacious dining area: soft scrambled eggs, seasoned potato cubes, either bacon or corned beef hash or sausage, toasty golden waffles you make yourself, a bunch of cereals and pastries and fresh fruit and muffins and english muffins and bagels, white and chocolate milk, several juices and pops, and a new thing for me - Japanese breakfast in the form of sticky white rice, miso and tofu and green onion broth to pour over the rice, and sprinkles you can choose to add of sesame or seaweed or shrimp. Plus, the extremely friendly and courteous staff roam around with refills of coffee in the most pleasant manner. Ah, yes, the staff. They were unfailiingly great! All were friendly, warm, knowledgeable, courteous, helpful and informative. When I couldn't find the breakfast room initially, they took me there. When I got cold and needed a blanket, it was there probably literally within one minute of my phone request. When someone spilled some orange juice, three staff appeared to clean it up and it was gone as quiickly as you could say "splat." When I stopped the room service guy to ask about dinner, his English was admittedly spotty, but he made good eye contact, had a truly warm smile, and finally just directed me to ask the front desk, which was fine due to his good manner. And for glbt travelers, the quiet presence of queer staff was extra-nice. The only problem we had during the whole stay was that our key cards somehow got demagnetized a few times and the front desk folks were absolutely fine with us needing to have them re-keyed. The location is great, but this place stands head and shoulders above other Hotel Circle places we have stayed. It is very convenient for getting everywhere. Also, on Mon-Thurs, they have an early evening buffet, which means if you're staying during the week you get not only breakfast but dinner if you want it, and are there at the right time, which sure cuts down on the cost of meals out if that's of significance. It was "May Grey" for us, so did not try the pool or hot tub, but I expect these would also be topnotch. It was extra-nice to have a very tall showerhead that actually splashed over me instead of against me. I didn't try out the gymn or the kids' game room, but both looked good. And they had ping-pong! I couldn't resist that - it was great. And outside, basketball and volleyball courts. All in all, I think this was one of the most relaxing places I've ever stayed. No worries and a ton of amenities, all supported by superb staff. The only reason I didn't rate it "excellent" was just that it wasn't a sixty-star place - but then, it doesn't mean to be, and it is far more a place I want to stay because of that.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ttchamps
Reviews.Content: Very nice place. We tried going there recently but it was a bit out of our price range at the time. I stayed there over a year ago and I was very impressed. Enough space to stretch out with the divided bedroom suites, and they were very nice and clean as well as having quiet and well maintained grounds. 2 TVs in each room are great for me to watch sports and for her to watch HGTV or whatever it may be :) Good breakfast buffet and the staff was very knowledgable and did their very best to cater to our requests and other needs. It is the prefered place for me to stay in SD when the budget allows for it.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back as soon as possible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of six stayed for five nights during spring break. It felt like a home away from home. The breakfast was wonderful (make your own waffles, eggs, sausage, cereal, yogurt, granola, I could go on and on). The was just enough seating during the very busy times with the tables in and out. It is a beautiful hotel with great customer service. They will even pick up groceries for you for free! We stayed in a Two bedroom kid's suite. It was very roomy and quiet, three tv's, a kitchen & a living room. The only thing odd about the room was the bathroom was located through the Parent's bedroom (we had an infant that would nap in there and was disturbed anytime someone needed to use the restroom). I think our kids looked forward to returning to the hotel every evening just as much as the attractions we were visiting. There were many other friendly families there, all the kids played together. We participated in the evening reception on our last night and wished we had discovered it sooner. We had lasagna and salad and drinks (red & white wine, and a microbrew on tap). It was so wonderful not to have to head back out in the evening to find some food, we got to swim, relax, eat, and swim some more. They also have bar-b-que's available for anyone to use. I am excited to go back just to stay at this hotel. Everything was so clean, well cared for and simply beautiful!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You sometimes get more than you pay for :)”
Reviews.Author: JulieJColorado
Reviews.Content: What a Hotel. Kids suites are a little pricy ($$) But well worth it. Two bedrooms. VERY NICE. Staff is extreemly friendly. Front desk has maps. Their maps show you return directions as well. Very helpful!! If they don't have if they will find it. Breakfast was wonderful!! Not your average donuts and coffee. Full breakfast. ( I had biscuits and gravy everyday for a week) The weekly manager reception is ok. Go early. Pool area very clean, game room small but all the games worked. Great exercise room. It gets a little busy, but is open 24 hours. If you ask the house keeping staff will clean around your schedule. They came at different times through out the day. Parking gets a little scarce around 2 or 3 pm. Plenty of parking in back. Stayed for a week, could have stayed longer. Sea World and Zoo great fun. Buy the year lond pass at Sea World, go back as many times as you want. (Hard to see all shows and animals in one day) Allow at least 2 days for each. We traveled with a 9 and 11 year old. Take lots of breaks. If you have extra time, check out the Scripps Aquariam. great view of the ocean and surfers. Go early, field trips came in around 10am. Lunch not great :( Eat off site. Have Fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne1986
Reviews.Content: In March 2006 my family stayed in one of the two bedroom units at the Residence Inn. The room was nice and had a nice amount of space for two adults and 3 children. The breakfast each morning was very nice but due to the crowds at the hotel (spring break) it was difficult to find a time that wasn't crowded. In the evening the complimentary "dinner" was a big hit with all of the families. On Monday night they weren't expecting such large crowds which caused quite a wait while additional food was being prepared. The second night there was an equally large crowd but the kitchen had prepared plenty of food and the lines moved quickly. The kids loved the pool and there was plenty of room for many kids to be in the pool at the same time. The location was very convenient to nearby sights. The one downside to staying at this hotel is that there aren't many restaurant options in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: greenberry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and had a great stay. The evening reception and the hot breakfast were both excellent, with plenty of food and drinks even on our second day when it was very crowded. I agree with the reviewer who mentioned the odd layout - to get to the lobby, we had to walk outside so that was a little strange. The bedroom was a bit on the small side, but we loved the large living room/kitchen area. The location was ideal for us, only about a 10-minute drive to either Old Town or Mission Bay, and about 15 minutes to La Jolla. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NickPT
Reviews.Content: We (two adults, two children) stayed for five nights, two of which the hotel appeared full. One bedroom suite was a decent size and beds were very comfortable. Everything was clean and in good shape. We never heard any of the neighbors and in spite of being across from an elevator it was very quiet. Breakfast was great, and there were plenty of tables. Staff was friendly and especially helpful with directions. You will need a car at this hotel. Location is good, very close to Zoo, Sea World, airport and Old Town. Large mall with restaurants is nearby, just off Hotel Circle north, easy to get to. Hotel parking is an extra $6. charge, which seems unnecessary and was annoying. Parking spaces seem particularly narrow, you need to be careful how you park. Computers & printer available for a modest fee. Very odd building layout - you have to go outside to get to the lobby, and only certain elevators go to the first floor. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - great waffles!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel - very clean and quiet. The room was a little bit smaller than I had expected. We appreciated the vanity/sink area being separate from the restroom. I also did not like the $6 parking fee, however, we always had a spot close to our room. The staff was very nice. The breakfast was great! A good variety and it changed slightly each day. I loved the make-your-own-waffles. They have pre-measured cups of waffle batter that you pour into the iron, flip over and it beeps when done. They were delicious. We really only heard other guests in the upstairs once (during Monday night football) and it was not loud enough to be annoying. We attended the social hour/manager's reception once. It was a hot dog meal. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Residence Inn was very nice and clean. The 2-bedroom suite was more than enough for my husband, 14-month old, 3-yr old, my mother-in-law, and myself. The location of the hotel was right off the freeway which was perfect since we visited attractions in different areas. Although you can't just walk around your hotel like in the dowtown district, we did not have to worry about being in traffic just to get to our hotel room after a busy and tiring day of adventures. Also, the complimentary breakfast buffet was more than I expected. It was a nice treat and such a convenience. I would definitely stay there the next time we visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed but maybe just not for us?”
Reviews.Author: AnneBerkhamsted_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week in August with other family members. The hotel is very clean and the suites are comfortable but we were disappointed with the facilities. The pool was much too small for a residence of this size and apart from an OK fitness room the other facilities were rather over-stated in the hotel details. There was a single multi-purpose sports court for volley ball, basket ball and badminton plus some games rooms which all required additional payment. Like a previous reviewer we were also a little taken aback by the $6 parking fee. I don't think we would have chosen a hotel in this location either. It is set back but it is still next to the highway with no views. At the end of the day, just not our kind of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: MacB
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel because we were fleeing the Holiday Inn nearby. Boy, what a difference! We chose the 2 bedroom Kid's Suite because we were travelling with 2 young boys. They loved the bunk beds, the private room and the TV all to themselves. My husband and loved the nice living room, clean kitchen, and comfortable king-sized bed in a private bedroom. (The Holiday Inn had the beds all sharing the same room.) The property in general is very lovely and the staff are extremely helpful and nice. And even though they are located right by the freeway, the rooms were quiet and very comfortable. The breakfast is included in the price of the room, but to be honest, it was just okay food. We had a much better meal at the coffee house just down the street. The second thing that would keep me from rating this property "excellent" is the parking fee of $6 every night. There was really no need to do this since there were other hotels all up and down the street and there was no way someone would want to park in their lot unless they were staying here. And last, the size of the master bedroom width-wise was barely big enough for the bed and dresser. When I had to get up in the middle of the night, my husband's feet and the blankets were right up next to the dresser and I nearly tripped trying to walk by. That was a bummer. The good night's rest made up for it, though. Other than those things, this is a very nice place to stay for families.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn San Diego Mission Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 1865 Hotel Circle South, San Diego, CA 92108
